text: In a hybrid remote customer portal refresh in energy where cultural norms differ across locations and team morale is slipping, what should the project manager do to continually evaluate effectiveness of virtual team engagement?

options.label: run retros or pulse checks on virtual collaboration and act on findings
assume no news means the virtual approach is fine
avoid changing anything to prevent disruption
ignore data showing low attendance

explanation: Option a is correct because regular feedback surfaces effectiveness issues to fix. Option b is incorrect because silence can mask disengagement. Option c is incorrect because resisting adjustments lets problems persist. Option d is incorrect because ignoring signals leads to continued poor engagement.

text: Given a outsourced delivery product launch in government services where the team spans five time zones and a release is planned in two sprints, which action best helps continually evaluate effectiveness of virtual team engagement?

options.label: ask only managers for opinions on engagement
track participation and follow up when engagement drops
run surveys but never share results
assume no news means the virtual approach is fine

explanation: Option b is correct because monitoring and response keep engagement healthy. Option a is incorrect because excluding team members misses real issues. Option c is incorrect because without transparency and action, evaluation loses trust. Option d is incorrect because silence can mask disengagement.
